Datatable.LocalizationPair: +5 Experience per Turn on Heroes on Empire
Enabling this will guarantee that factions spawn with planets specifically chosen for them.
Factions will spawn with specifically chosen home systems.
Factions will spawn with random star systems.
Enabling this make luxuries have their revised ESG effects in system development.
Luxuries will have their revised ESG effects in system development.
Luxuries will have their vanilla effects in system development.

Enabling this give defensive bonuses to players not in an alliance, so that it scales like all other victory types.
Home systems will gain defensive bonuses based off of number of players, and lose it per alliance member.
Home systems will not gain defensive bonuses based off of number of players, and lose it per alliance member.
+100% Troop Health [moins] (% of Players in the galaxy in your Alliance)
Enabling this will allow you to trade rare modules and system improvements between players..

Enabling this will allow you to terraform planets to increase size. Disabling this will make it just like vanilla. Enabling free terraformation with this enabled will allow you to terraform planet sizes down.
You will be able to terraform planet sizes.
You will not be able to terraform planet sizes.

Enabling this will allow you to terraform gas planets. Disabling this will make you unable to terraform gas planets. Enabling free terraformation with this enabled will allow you to terraform between telluric and jovian planets.
You will be able to terraform gas planets.
You will not be able to terraform gas planets.
Enabling this will allow the Umbral Choir to hack Sanctuaries onto systems required for Supremacy Victory. Disabling will prevent any shenanigans trouble-maker players will start.
You will be able to create sanctuaries on major faction home-systems.
You will not be able to create sanctuaries on major faction home-systems.

The ESG mod occasionally adds content rather than just rebalancing. Disabling this will allow you experience the game without any of this added content. This mostly includes modules, system improvements, and empire improvements.
You will be able to use ESG Mod content.
You will not be able to use ESG Mod content.
Turning this setting off disallows anyone from creating or joining an alliance.
You will be able to create/join alliances.
You will not be able to create/join alliances.
This trait is used to customize AI behavior. Leaving a custom faction with no traits will make the AI act like a standard faction, with no preferences.
Wormhole travel consumes only a half of a ship's remaining movement points
Provides a +15 bonus of Dust [dustColored] per turn; bonus increases by +15 per turn
Reach $Amount01Name [prestigeColored] per [turn] and $Amount02Name [happinessColored] in your Empire

Favored by monsters and hermits, swamp worlds offer fetid bogs, thick mists, and decent yields of methane gas. Less widely known, however, is their capacity for producing incredible crops of funky, yet still edible, fungi, due to the perfect conditions of moisture and mulch.

Colonization of Swamp-type planets relies on inventions that master the various systems needed for filtration and drainage, as deadly chemicals and radiation are often abundant in the atmosphere and soil. The environments are deadly and unforgiving if these processes are not executed perfectly.

As close as one can get to a livable star, these whirling storms of atmospheric silica can be developed through the application of space debris and ruthless high-energy bombardment, stirring the planet to ignition and creating a world of flaming skies.

Solar arrays and a layer of carefully organized greenhouse gases can turn a a Jovian planet into a kind of atmospheric oven, eventually turning into a self-sustaining celestial engine ready to drive heavy industrial arrays.

Planetary filters and invisible gases allow heat to be trapped without blocking sunlight, creating worlds with excellent solar exposure while retaining the unique industrial outputs of a planet practically made of easy-to-access materials.

Beautiful and breezy, it takes a lot of asteroid mining to collect the ice necessary to create a water vapor atmosphere, but once the thawing is done the sapphire blue skies of a temperate Jovian make a life in the sky downright pleasant.

Sealed stations spray massive clouds of ammonia into the humid atmosphere to create these planets, balancing it with water vapor to accommodate floating research settlements capable of easy reconfiguration.

The removal of water from an ammonia-heavy atmosphere allows for even lower temperatures, turning a Jovian planet into a celestial refrigerator suitable for all sorts of super-computer development projects, though life becomes even more difficult for their crews and science teams.
Can Terraform following Planets to Gas Frozen:
Can Terraform following Planets to Gas Cold:
Can Terraform following Planets to Gas Temperate:
Can Terraform following Planets to Gas Warm:
Can Terraform following Planets to Gas Hot:
Can Terraform following Planets to Gas Burning:
Can Terraform following Planets to Huge:
Can Terraform following Planets to Large:

Can Terraform following Planets to Small:
Can Terraform following Planets to Tiny:

The simplest method of making a planet bigger is to simply smash it into another celestial object, and wait for the dust to settle. With the newest gravity manipulation tech though, this natural process can be scheduled and accelerated, drawing in asteroids and meteorite swarms for on-demand mountains and raw mass.

Making a planet smaller is a terrifying and violent ordeal, but by no means a creative or complex one. Simply find the densest celestial body available, and smash it into the planet at a shallow angle, blowing entire continents into space like planetary blood spatter before carving out the environment again. A small apocalypse, applied as mere infrastructure.

Likely the simplest kind of terraforming, a gas planet only requires a shift in atmosphere, accomplished through networks of low orbit satellites which spray chemical additives to change temperature and weather hostility.
Planet Terraformation between types of Gas Planets

The most difficult kind of terraforming, even the Endless struggled with the process of collapsing Jovian planets and dismantling Telluric ones, for a time anyways. Nanites, atmospheric manipulation, and old fashioned explosives can shred a planet into a cloud of particles, while hovering chemical plants and asteroid collection campaigns are necessary to turn a planets atmosphere to liquid seas and mold a solid core.
Planet Terraformation between Gas and Telluric Planets

While advanced construction makes housing and infrastructure an increasingly minor concern, people will always want a bit more natural space. New tractor beam technology and gravitic manipulators will allow space debris to be gently lowered to a planets surface, then shaken apart and evenly redistributed to slowly increase a worlds overall mass. Finally, people can have more of the same worlds they love.
Planet Terraformation to increase Planet Size

Quick and easy, the most difficult part of shrinking a planet is convincing it's inhabitants to participate in the destruction of their own home. There are few, if any, reasons to go along with such a plan, and even for the interstellar empire pulling the strings it will likely appear a nonsensical act of spite, like destroying a mountain as vengeance for an avalanche. Reverse psychology and new temporary orbital housing technology allow the people to be kept safe during the horrifying process of planet reduction, enabling this new and strange method to be applied.
Planet Terraformation to decrease Planet Size

Shield regenerated each second on Flotilla
After the ship has taken damage in battle, this module is triggered to partially regenerate its protective capability.
After the ship has taken damage in battle, this module can be triggered to regenerate a significant percentage of its protective capability.
Long range armor-shredding burst weaponry, fires once per phase with very high damage and reduces armor by 30%.
Damage caused by your Coilgun weapons: #E3BDAC#{0}#REVERT#
Coilguns bypass defenses and shatter armor; stay on Short range as much as possible, they aren't very accurate outside of Long range.
Coilguns are especially powerful on Long range, stay away from enemies and let the guns do their work!

Boarding Pods reduce [manPower] of enemy Ships every second. The enemy Ship is captured if a Boarding Pod is active and the Ship reaches 0 [manPower]. Manpower damage is impacted by relative Infantry strength, so Infantry upgrades will affect your damage. Boarding Pods will not target special ships. Boarding Pods will not consume manpower from the source ship.
The hero learns to masterfully track the Stock Market, and can predict the most accurate investments for the system.

When you add a module to a slot of this ship, #E3BDAC#{0}#REVERT# modules will actually be equipped (so the power and the cost is multiplied by the same amount).
Module effects colored in #C48594#red#REVERT# scale with module multiplier. Module effects colored in #6999D5#blue#REVERT# scale with level and module multiplier.
#C48594#Increase Shield Absorption of every Ship on Flotilla#REVERT#
